title: A Trek To A Farm Where Christmas Trees Are Born
teaser: Farmer Michael Smolack in Andover, Mass., says what kind of tree you pick likely depends on where you live.
contentencoded:
Americans bought about 33 million Christmas trees last year, according to the National Christmas Tree Association. The majority of those were pre-cut and bought on a tree lot.

Here & Now’s Peter O’Dowd took a trip to North Andover, Mass., where some of those trees are grown. Farmer Michael Smolack told him that what kind of tree you pick likely depends on where you live.

  • Photo:Â It’s a Charlie Brown Christmas for “ugly” Pennsylvania tree
